curam.util.common.util

Class StringUtils

  • java.lang.Object

  • public class StringUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Some common string utility functions.

        public static boolean isJavaIdentifier(java.lang.String identifier)
        Checks if a string is a valid Java identifier. Java keywords are considered valid identifiers.

        Returns:
        true if the string is a valid Java identifier, false, otherwise.

      • isJavaIdentifier

        public static boolean isJavaIdentifier(char[] chars)
        Checks if a character array represents a valid Java identifier. Java keywords are considered valid identifiers. This is more efficient than calling the StringUtils.isJavaIdentifier(String) method if the identifier is not already a string.
        Parameters:
        chars - The characters to be tested.
        Returns:
        true if the string is a valid Java identifier, false, otherwise.

      • makeJavaIdentifier

        Makes a Java Identifier string without a parameter prefix. Just calls the method that handles it with a prefix passing null.
        Parameters:
        value - String being changed.
        Returns:
        String The modified string.

      • makeJavaIdentifier

                                                  java.lang.String prefix)
        Makes a Java Identifier string by checking each of the characters within the string and replacing any that cannot be used with their `hexademical`.
        Parameters:
        value - String being changed.
        prefix - The prefix added to the modified string.
        Returns:
        String String that is a Java identifier.

      • evaluateFlag

        public static java.lang.Boolean evaluateFlag(java.lang.String value)
        Evaluates a flag value to determine if it is true or false. A flag may be specified as "true" or "false", "yes" or "no", or "on" or "off", and in any mix of upper- or lower-case. If the flag value cannot be determined, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        value - The value of the flag.
        Returns:
        The value of the flag, or null if the value cannot be determined.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the value is null.

      • parsePropertyName

        public static java.lang.String parsePropertyName(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Parses a field name to try to extract a name suitable for displaying as the title of a field when displayed in a GUI. The algorithm is simple: the sub-string after the last occurrence of the '$' character (or the whole string if there is no '$') is parsed, the first letter of the sub-string is capitalized and a space character is inserted before any other capital letters in the string unless the capital letter was was preceded by a capital letter. Similarly for digits, a space is placed before the first digit and subsequent letters are appended.

        For example: "p6$dtls$value$dtls$concernRoleID" becomes "Concern Role ID" and "p6$dtls$addressLine1" becomes "Address Line 1".

        Parameters:
        fieldName - String The Field name.
        Returns:
        String the parsed field name.

      • localizeString

        public static java.lang.String localizeString(java.lang.String toBeLocalized,
                                              java.util.Locale locale)
        Chooses output message according to user locale. The string containing messages for all the locales is a column-char delimited string containing locale codes and text for each of them, e.g. `en|English message|en_US|US message|fr|French message`.
        Parameters:
        toBeLocalized - string containing locale codes and text for each of them in the above format.
        locale - java.util.Locale object representing current user locale.
        Returns:
        localized String to be displayed.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If there is no non-null or non-empty message for the locale or its fall-backs.

      • getFallbackLocale

        public static java.lang.String getFallbackLocale(java.lang.String locale)
        Get the fall-back locale. For example, if the locale is "en_US", return "en". If the locale is "en", return "".
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale to be processed.
        Returns:
        The fall-back locale.

      • escapeString

        public static java.lang.String escapeString(java.lang.String string,
                                            char escapeChar,
                                            java.lang.String charsToEscape)
        Escapes a string by inserting the escape character before each occurrence of any of the characters that are to be escaped. The characters to be escaped are specified as a string of characters. The escape character itself will be escaped automatically whether or not it is contained in the string of characters to be escaped. The StringUtils.unescapeString(String, char) method performs the reverse operation.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to be escaped.
        escapeChar - The character to use when escaping other characters.
        charsToEscape - A string containing the characters that should be escaped where the occur in the string to be escaped.
        Returns:
        The escaped string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If any parameter is null.

      • unescapeString

        public static java.lang.String unescapeString(java.lang.String string,
                                              char escapeChar)
        Un-escapes a string by removing the escape character before each escaped character. The StringUtils.escapeString(String, char, String) method performs the reverse operation. An exception will be thrown if the last character in the string is the escape character will no following character to be escaped. It is OK for the last character to be the escape character if it is correctly escaped itself.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to be un-escaped.
        escapeChar - The character used to escape other characters.
        Returns:
        The un-escaped string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the input string is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the string is not correctly escaped.

      • countChar

        public static int countChar(char character,
                            java.lang.String string)
        Counts the number of occurrences of a character in a string.
        Parameters:
        character - The character to search for.
        string - The string to search.
        Returns:
        The number of occurrences of the character in the string. If the string is null, zero will be returned.

      • isNullOrEmpty

        public static final boolean isNullOrEmpty(java.lang.String value)
        Tests if a string value is null or is an empty string.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be tested.
        Returns:
        true if the value is either null or empty, false otherwise.

      • isSet

        public static final boolean isSet(java.lang.String value)
        Tests if a string value is not null, not empty and not composed entirely of whitespace. Whitespace is considered to be any character with a value less than or equal to a space character.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be tested.
        Returns:
        true if the value is not null and contains characters other than just whitespace characters.

      • join

        public static java.lang.String join(java.lang.String separator,
                                    java.lang.String... values)
        Joins strings together using the given separator string. The separator string is only added where it is not already present when the strings are joined. If a string already ends with the separator string, then no separator string will be added when another string is joined to the end of that string. Similarly, if a string starts with the separator string, then no separator string will be added when that string is joined to the end of another string. If two strings to be joined end and start with the separator string respectively, the separator string will not be removed from either. For example, where the separator is a comma, joining "a" and "b" will give "a,b"; joining "a," and "b" will give "a,b"; joining "a" and ",b" will give "a,b"; joining "a," and ",b" will give "a,,b"; and, because whitespace is ignored, joining "a, " (trailing space) with "b" will give "a, ,b". Values that are null or empty will be ignored. For example, joining "a", "" (empty string) and "b" will result in "a,b" and not "a,,b".
        Parameters:
        separator - The separator string to use when joining the strings. This may be null or empty if no separator is required.
        values - One or more string values to be joined together. If any values are null or empty, they will be ignored. A variable length list of arguments may be used. If, instead, the values are passed as an array, the array must not be null.
        Returns:
        The result of joining the strings together with the given separator string. If all of the values are null or empty, the result will be an empty string.
